title: Smart Microgrid, Second-Life Batteries, and Energy Justice: Inside Slim Strandnet
subtitle: How The Hague built a community energy cooperative at Scheveningen that solved grid congestion years before it became a national crisis — and was named top-3 government innovation in the Netherlands in 2025
featuredImageAlt: Slim Strandnet smart microgrid at Scheveningen harbour, The Hague — community energy cooperative with second-life EV batteries and solar panels
excerpt: The Hague's smart microgrid at Scheveningen — known as Slim Strandnet — started in 2016, years before grid congestion became a national crisis. Today it runs on second-life EV batteries, circular solar panels, and an energy cooperative that puts energy justice at its core. Named top-3 government innovation in the Netherlands in 2025.
